de.tud.kom.p2psim.api.scenario
Interface Configurator

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultConfigurator
public interface Configurator

An implementation of this interface is used to access and probably parse the file describing the configuration of the simulator. The simulator is configured from XML files with a flexible but still constrained structure. Few features of this files are

  • Support for variables which can be passed to the configurator from outside (e.g. command line)
  • Arbitrary new components can be configured via this configurator without to change the configurator
TODO describe an example config file and the rules (or point to the documentation)

Version:
3.0, 03.12.2007
Author:
Konstantin Pussep, Sebastian Kaune

Method Detail

getConfigurable

Configurable getConfigurable(java.lang.String name)
Get a configurable which was already parsed and configured. This is the common way how configurables can access each other during the configuration process or how the simulation engine can obtain the configuration result.

Parameters:
name - - configurable's name (which is same as in the configuration file).
Returns:
configured configurable or null if there is no configurable with the given name

parseValue

java.lang.String parseValue(java.lang.String valueString)
Parse value. If the argument starts with a $ sign then it will be interpreted as a variable name and the variable value will be returned. If the variable was not set the result will be null. If the argument contains no $ sign, the valueString parameter will be just forwarded as the return value.

Parameters:
valueString - - string to be parsed, either plain value or variable name with preceding $
Returns:
the value of the variable named valueString, null, or the valueString
